item.title: AAP Punjab MLA Gurpreet Gogi Bassi found dead due to gunshot wound under ‘mysterious circumstances’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
AAP Punjab MLA Gurpreet Gogi Bassi Found Dead from Gunshot Wound

Date: Jan 11, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

AAP MLA Gurpreet Gogi Bassi from Ludhiana West was declared dead due to a gunshot wound late Friday night, with the cause of death still under investigation.

  • Gurpreet Gogi Bassi was declared dead on arrival at Dayanand Medical College and Hospital.
  • An autopsy will confirm if his death was due to suicide or accidental firing.
  • Bassi had recently participated in community activities, including a cleanliness drive.
  • He joined AAP in 2022, defeating a two-time MLA in the elections.
“The cause of death is yet to be determined,” said commissioner Kuldeep Singh Chahal.

This tragic incident raises concerns about the safety of politicians and the circumstances surrounding such incidents in Punjab.

item.title: Rekhachithram Box Office Collection Day 2 - Sacnilk
item.description:
Rekhachithram Box Office Collection Day 2

Publication Date: January 10, 2025

Source: Sacnilk

Rekhachithram performed well on its first day at the box office with an estimated ₹ 1.90 Cr in India net. On its second day, it earned around ₹ 2.35 Cr, bringing the total collection to ₹ 4.25 Cr.

Key Points:

  • Day 1 Box Office: ₹ 1.90 Cr
  • Day 2 Box Office: ₹ 2.35 Cr (early estimates)
  • Total Box Office Collection: ₹ 4.25 Cr
  • Overall Malayalam Occupancy: 44.39%

Occupancy Breakdown:

  • Kochi: 60.25%
  • Trivandrum: 36.25%
  • Bengaluru: 49.25%
  • Chennai: 51.33%
  • Kozhikode: 48.75%
  • Thrissur: 42.50%
  • Kollam: 46.25%
  • Kottayam: 52.50%
  • Hyderabad: 58.00%
  • NCR: 25.33%
  • Mumbai: 18.75%
Disclaimer: The Box Office Data are compiled from various sources and by our own research. These data can be approximate and Sacnilk does not make any claims about the authenticity of the data.

Overall, Rekhachithram shows promising performance, and further updates will follow.

item.title: ‘Despicable charade, no merit’ says Donald Trump after unconditional discharge in hush money case - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Trump Claims 'Witch Hunt' After Being Discharged in Hush Money Case

Date: Jan 11, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Donald Trump expressed his outrage over the Biden-Harris administration's actions against him, labeling it a 'witch hunt' after receiving an unconditional discharge in his hush money trial despite 34 felony counts.

  • Trump was convicted of 34 felony counts but received an unconditional discharge, avoiding jail time and fines.
  • He condemned the charges as baseless and claimed they were a result of political oppression.
  • Trump announced plans to appeal the case, which he called a 'hoax' and a 'scam'.
  • The case involved a $130,000 payment to an adult film star to prevent an affair from being disclosed during his presidential campaign.
“That result alone proves that, as all Legal Scholars and Experts have said, THERE IS NO CASE, THERE WAS NEVER A CASE, and this whole Scam fully deserves to be DISMISSED,” said Trump.

This case highlights the ongoing legal battles Trump faces and has reignited his claims of being unjustly targeted by political opponents.

item.title: 'Penalise if...': MP writes to minister after L&T chairman's '90-hour' remarks - Hindustan Times
item.description:
MP Urges Labour Minister to Penalise Violations After L&T Chairman's Controversial '90-Hour' Workweek Remarks

Date: Jan 11, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Following remarks by L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan advocating for a 90-hour workweek, MP Raja Ram Singh has called for penalties against violations of working hour laws in India.

  • Subrahmanyan suggested working on Sundays, leading to widespread online outrage.
  • MP Raja Ram Singh referenced statements from prominent business figures advocating longer work hours.
  • Singh emphasized the negative impacts of long working hours on employee health and productivity.
  • He requested enforcement of existing labour laws to protect workers' rights and well-being.
  • Statistics from the International Labour Organization show India's workforce among the hardest working globally.
“It is important to note that not only does working longer hours not ensure increased productivity, but in fact reduces productivity.” - MP Raja Ram Singh

This incident highlights the need for a review of workplace practices and protections for employees in India.

item.title: OnePlus 12 vs. OnePlus 13: Is it upgraded enough? [Video] - 9to5Google
item.description:
OnePlus 12 vs. OnePlus 13: Is it upgraded enough?

Publication Date: January 7, 2025 | Source: 9to5Google

The OnePlus 12 has set a high bar for the OnePlus 13 to meet. In this article, we explore whether the OnePlus 13 offers significant upgrades or if the previous model remains a strong contender.

  • Similar design language between OnePlus 12 and 13.
  • Improvements in OxygenOS and hardware features.
  • The OnePlus 13 boasts an IP69 rating vs. IP65 for the OnePlus 12.
  • Battery capacity increased to 6,000 mAh with improved thermal management.
  • Camera comparisons highlight some downgrades in zoom capabilities for the OnePlus 13.
“Nobody who owns the OnePlus 12 should ditch their device in favor of the OnePlus 13.”

Ultimately, while both models are impressive, the OnePlus 12 remains a solid choice for existing users, with the OnePlus 13 being a worthy option for new buyers.

item.title: 10 natural sources of magnesium that are easily available - The Times of India
item.description:
10 Natural Sources of Magnesium That Are Easily Available

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 Source: Times of India

Magnesium plays a vital role in maintaining healthy muscles, bones, and overall well-being. Here are 10 easily available natural sources of magnesium to help boost your daily intake.

  • Almonds: 270 mg per 100 grams
  • Pumpkin seeds: 168 mg per 100 grams
  • Black beans: 70 mg per 100 grams
  • Tofu: 30 mg per 100 grams
  • Avocados: Rich in magnesium
  • Dark chocolate: 228 mg per 100 grams
  • Chia seeds: 335 mg per 100 grams
  • Spinach: 79 mg per 100 grams
  • Bananas: 27 mg per 100 grams
  • Yogurt: 11 mg per 100 grams
“Magnesium is essential for muscle function and overall health.”

This article highlights the importance of including magnesium-rich foods in your diet for better health and well-being.

item.title: This brain-boosting Indian herb is becoming popular globally; know all about it - The Times of India
item.description:
This brain-boosting Indian herb is becoming popular globally; know all about it

Publication date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Bacopa, an ancient Indian herb used in Ayurvedic medicine, is gaining global popularity for its cognitive-enhancing properties. Research has shown significant improvements in memory, focus, and reducing inflammation after supplementation.

  • Bacopa monnieri, the most notable species, improves memory and cognitive functions.
  • A study involving 80 participants showed cognitive enhancements after 12 weeks of daily 300mg supplementation.
  • The herb contains bioactive compounds, particularly Bacosides, believed to enhance brain function.
  • Bacopa is also suggested to help alleviate neurological disorders and combat oxidative stress.
  • It is recommended to consume Bacopa in supplement form, with a maximum intake of 600 mg per day.
“Bacopa has become the latest must-have supplement to sharpen one's mind and boost cognitive performance.”

In conclusion, Bacopa is emerging as a valuable supplement for those looking to enhance their cognitive abilities and overall brain health.

item.title: My thinking in 3rd term has changed vastly in terms of vision, scope: PM Modi on podcast with Nikhil Kama - The Times of India
item.description:
My thinking in 3rd term has changed vastly in terms of vision, scope: PM Modi on podcast with Nikhil Kamath

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Prime Minister Narendra Modi discusses the evolution of his vision and approach in his third term during a podcast with entrepreneur Nikhil Kamath. He elaborates on the changes in his thought process and the broader implications for governance.

  • Modi emphasizes a significant shift in his perspective since starting his third term.
  • The Prime Minister talks about adapting to new challenges and visions for India's future.
  • He highlights the importance of encompassing a wider scope in governance.
“My vision has expanded, and I recognize the need for a broader approach in governance.”

Modi's comments underline his proactive stance on adjusting to evolving political landscapes and societal needs.

item.title: Rajiv Bajaj jumps in on ‘90-hr work week' debate: 'Quality of work matters, not time' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rajiv Bajaj also said that if one wants 90-hour work week, it should start from the top.

Publication Date: Jan 11, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Amid an online outrage over Larsen & Toubro (L&T) chairperson's “90-hour work week” remarks, Bajaj Auto's managing director Rajiv Bajaj has said that the quality of work done matters much more than the hours.

In an interview with CNBC TV18, Rajiv Bajaj emphasized that if there is to be a 90-hour work week, it should originate from the leadership. He stated, "Number of hours of work doesn't matter, the quality of work does. We need a kinder, gentler world more than ever before."

Key Points:

  • Rajiv Bajaj argues that quality of work is more important than the number of hours worked.
  • Bajaj suggests that the idea of a 90-hour work week should start from company leaders.
  • He stresses the importance of work-life balance and the consequences of long working hours.
  • The controversy originated from remarks made by L&T chairman SN Subrahmanyan advocating for longer work hours.
"Even if someone works 70 or 90 hours a week, their life remains interconnected with other aspects - family, health, and well-being. Ignoring this interconnectedness will come at a cost."

In conclusion, Bajaj calls for a shift away from rigid work hours towards a more flexible approach that values quality and interconnectedness in life.

item.title: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah's Gurucharan Singh is not eating any food, he is very unwell, says friend Bhakti Soni - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Gurucharan Singh of Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah Hospitalized and Struggling with Health

Date: Jan 10, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Actor Gurucharan Singh, known for his role in Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah, is currently hospitalized in Mumbai. His friend Bhakti Soni has shared updates about his deteriorating health, stating he has stopped eating and is very weak.

  • Bhakti Soni revealed that Gurucharan has been unable to eat solid food for three months and has only consumed a liquid diet.
  • He fell unconscious recently due to not drinking water as well.
  • Gurucharan's family is reportedly facing financial difficulties, which may have contributed to his condition.
  • His friend Bhakti mentioned that attempts to communicate with Gurucharan have been unsuccessful as his family’s phones are switched off.
“I haven’t spoken to Gurucharan. I don’t know what’s happening with him, but from what I heard last, he is very weak.” - Bhakti Soni

Gurucharan shared a video from his hospital bed on Instagram, stating his condition has worsened and he will update fans about his health soon.

item.title: Donald Trump 1st US President To Be Sentenced As Felon, But Avoids Jail, Penalty - NDTV
item.description:
Donald Trump Becomes First US President Sentenced as Felon, Escapes Jail Time

Date: January 25, 2025 | Source: NDTV

Donald Trump has made history by becoming the first felon in the White House, as a US court upholds his conviction in a hush money case. Although he was sentenced to an 'unconditional discharge', he will not serve jail time due to his position as President-elect.

  • Trump was convicted of falsifying business records related to payments made to Stormy Daniels.
  • He faced potential jail time of four years but was spared due to presidential immunity.
  • Judge Juan Merchan described the circumstances as unique and remarked on the legal implications of sentencing a sitting president.
  • Trump did not attend the court session in person and instead appeared virtually.
  • He characterized the legal proceedings as damaging to his reputation and a setback for the New York court system.
"This court has determined that the only lawful sentence that permits entry of a judgement of conviction without encroaching on the highest office of the land, is an unconditional discharge." - Judge Juan Merchan
"It was done to damage my reputation, just so that I may lose the election." - Donald Trump

In a significant ruling, this event illustrates the complexities of legal accountability at the highest levels of government, setting a precedent for the future.

item.title: US to impose sanctions on Russian oil fleet and traders, document shows - Reuters
item.description:
US to impose sanctions on Russian oil fleet and traders, document shows

Publication Date: January 10, 2023
Source: Reuters

The United States plans to impose stringent sanctions on Russia's oil industry, affecting around 180 ships and multiple traders. This move follows ongoing tensions due to the Ukraine war and could significantly disrupt Russian oil exports to major buyers like India and China.

  • Sanctions target around 180 ships, dozens of traders
  • Gazprom Neft, Surgut, ship insurers added to the list
  • Biden team had sought to avoid price spike
  • New Trump administration has said will seek to end Ukraine war
  • Reuters could not immediately verify the document
According to the document, the U.S. Treasury would allow a transition period to March 12, allowing some energy-related transactions to be completed.

This action represents a significant escalation in U.S. efforts to minimize Russia's capacity to fund its military actions through oil exports.

item.title: Stock Market Weekly Recap: NIFTY, SENSEX tank 2% to over 7-week low on unabated FII outflows - Upstox
item.description:
Stock Market Weekly Recap: NIFTY, SENSEX tank 2% to over 7-week low on unabated FII outflows

Publication Date: January 10, 2024 | Source: Upstox

The stock markets experienced significant declines this week, with NIFTY and SENSEX dropping over 2% to close at multi-week lows due to large Foreign Institutional Investor (FII) outflows and unfavourable market conditions.

  • The market crash on Monday erased around ₹11 lakh crore of investors’ wealth.
  • The SENSEX fell by 2.37% (1,844 points) and NIFTY by 2.80% (662 points) on a weekly basis.
  • FIIs sold shares worth more than ₹16,800 crore this week.
  • US bond yields surged to their highest since April 2024, affecting market sentiment.
  • Downgrade in Indian GDP growth estimate to 6.4% for FY25 influenced market performance.
  • The IT sector showed some resilience with positive results from TCS.
  • Adani Wilmar shares crashed 10% amid news of stake sale by the Adani Group.
"The market crash wiped out around ₹11 lakh crore of investors’ wealth in a single session."

The week was tumultuous for investors as multiple factors converged to create a challenging environment, leading to significant market losses.

item.title: Woman from Myanmar undergoes liver transplant at hospital in Chennai - The Hindu
item.description:
Woman from Myanmar undergoes liver transplant at hospital in Chennai

Published: January 10, 2025 08:51 pm IST

A 66-year-old woman from Myanmar underwent a liver transplant surgery at a private hospital in Chennai after being diagnosed with advanced liver disease.

  • The woman suffered from ascites, pedal oedema, and jaundice due to hepatitis C virus-induced hepatocellular carcinoma.
  • The surgery was led by Magnus Jayaraj and Karthik Raj M. at GEM Hospitals.
  • A living donor liver transplant was performed with her niece donating a part of her liver.
  • The patient is now recovering and preparing to return to Myanmar.

item.title: Hush money case: US judge sentences Donald Trump, declines to impose jail term, fine - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Donald Trump Sentenced in Hush Money Case

Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A US judge sentenced President-elect Donald Trump over a criminal conviction related to hush money paid to a porn star. The verdict marks the first felony conviction for a US president, but Trump will not face jail or a fine.

  • The judge imposed the mildest criminal sanction available: an unconditional discharge.
  • Judge Juan M Merchan cited unique circumstances surrounding the case.
  • Trump was convicted on 34 counts of falsifying business records.
  • He claims the conviction is intended to sabotage his presidential campaign.
"Never before has this court been presented with such a unique and remarkable set of circumstances." - Judge Juan M Merchan

The case revolves around a payment of $130,000 to Stormy Daniels, made to suppress disclosure about an alleged encounter during Trump's 2016 campaign. Trump denied the encounter and claimed the verdict was politically motivated.

item.title: 45-minute sauna lands woman in hospital due to heat stroke - The Times of India
item.description:
Woman Hospitalized After Sauna Session Leads to Heat Stroke

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: [Insert Source Here]

A woman in her early 70s was admitted to a hospital in the UK after suffering heat stroke due to a 45-minute sauna session. Her body temperature soared to 107.6°F, significantly surpassing normal levels, leading to severe health complications.

  • The woman fainted after her sauna session and was hospitalized.
  • Her elevated body temperature posed risks of brain damage.
  • Vital signs showed reduced blood pressure and accelerated heart rate.
  • Diagnosed with severe exertional heat, she required immediate treatment.
  • After treatment, her temperature normalized, but she faced significant health threats.
  • She made a full recovery after 12 days in the hospital, without need for advanced organ support.
"If not treated within an hour, heat stroke can be fatal leading to death."

In conclusion, understanding the dangers of prolonged heat exposure is crucial, as immediate actions can save lives in heat stroke situations.

item.title: Cognizant CEO Ravi Kumar indulged in anticompetitive tactics and ..., says Infosys in counterclaim agains - The Times of India
item.description:
Cognizant CEO Faces Anticompetitive Allegations from Infosys

Publication Date: October 20, 2023 Source: Times of India

Infosys has made a counterclaim against Cognizant and its CEO Ravi Kumar, alleging that the latter engaged in anticompetitive tactics.

  • The counterclaim accuses the Cognizant CEO of unfair competition practices.
  • Infosys seeks legal recourse in this ongoing dispute.
  • The claims highlight growing tensions in the IT industry regarding competitive practices.
“This is a significant move in the tech industry landscape,” said a legal expert.

This case underscores the increasing scrutiny of corporate behavior in tech and raises questions about competitive fairness.

item.title: Tech wrap Jan 10: Xiaomi Pad 7 launch, OnePlus 13 sale, DailyObjects LOOP - Business Standard
item.description:
Tech wrap Jan 10: Xiaomi Pad 7 launch, OnePlus 13 sale, DailyObjects LOOP

Publication Date: January 10, 2023

Source: Unknown

This article covers the latest tech news including the launch of the Xiaomi Pad 7 and OnePlus 13 in India and new products from DailyObjects.

  • Xiaomi Pad 7: Features Qualcomm Snapdragon 7 Plus Gen 3, available with a Nano Texture Display and runs on HyperOS 2.
  • OnePlus 13: Launched on January 7, powered by Snapdragon 8 Elite, equipped with Hasselblad camera, running Oxygen OS 15.
  • DailyObjects LOOP: New series of MagSafe-compatible power banks, Qi2-certified, with 15W wireless charging.
  • Redmi 14C 5G: Up for sale in India starting at Rs 9,999, featuring dual 5G support and premium design.
  • Google AI Podcast: Testing personalized daily podcasts feature called Daily Listen.
  • Meta's Content Moderation Changes: Increased searches on deleting accounts following changes in moderation policy.
  • Meta Discontinuation: Ending third-party fact-checking in the US, shifting to user-generated Community Notes.

item.description:
OnePlus 13 series is now available for purchase: Price in India, offers and more

Publication Date: [Date not provided] | Source: Times of India

The OnePlus 13 series has officially launched and is now available for purchase in India, featuring several new offers and pricing details for customers.

  • Launch of OnePlus 13 series models.
  • Competitive pricing aimed at the midrange smartphone market.
  • Various promotional offers on specific models.
  • Positive reception among tech enthusiasts and early buyers.
“The OnePlus 13 offers exceptional value in performance and features.”

This series aims to strengthen OnePlus's position in a competitive market, offering customers high-end specifications at accessible prices.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 series full specs leaked ahead of January 22 Unpacked event: Details - The Financial Express
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Series Full Specs Leaked Ahead of January 22 Unpacked Event

Publication Date: January 15, 2024

Source: Financial Express

The Galaxy S25 series is set for launch soon, and leaks reveal detailed specifications for the Galaxy S25, Galaxy S25+, and Galaxy S25 Ultra models, including their display, performance, and camera features.

Key Points

  • The Galaxy S25 features a 6.2-inch Dynamic AMOLED 2X display with Full HD+ (2340 x 1080) resolution and a 120Hz refresh rate.
  • It is powered by the Snapdragon 8 Elite for Galaxy chipset with 12GB of RAM and storage options of 128GB, 256GB, and 512GB.
  • Camera setup includes a 50MP primary, 12MP ultrawide, and 10MP telephoto lens with OIS.
  • Battery capacity stands at 4,000mAh with 25W wired fast charging and wireless charging support.
  • The Galaxy S25+ has a larger screen at 6.7 inches, WQHD resolution, a bigger 4,900mAh battery, and similar camera specifications.
  • The flagship Galaxy S25 Ultra includes a 6.9-inch display, advanced 200MP camera, and a capacity of up to 1TB storage.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

The S25 Ultra model features the highest level of detail and color accuracy with its massive 6.9-inch display and exceptional camera capabilities.

The phone runs on Android 15 with Samsung’s One UI 7 for a user-friendly experience.

item.title: Third HMPV case reported from Ahmedabad, state tally reaches four - Gujarat Samachar
item.description:
Third HMPV Case Reported in Ahmedabad, Tally Reaches Four in Gujarat

Publication Date: Friday | Source: Gujarat Samachar

A new HMPV case has been reported from Ahmedabad, bringing the state's total to four cases. This incident marks the third reported case from Ahmedabad.

  • The latest patient is a nine-month-old infant transferred from Viha Children’s Hospital to Childhood Hospital.
  • The previous case involved an 80-year-old man who tested positive and was admitted to Sterling Hospital.
  • Three cases of HMPV have been confirmed in Ahmedabad and one in Prantij.
  • HMPV is a respiratory virus that tends to peak in winter, particularly affecting young children and the elderly.
  • Advisory issued by the state urges citizens to follow health guidelines to combat respiratory infections.
“Metapneumovirus (HMPV) is similar to other respiratory viruses, and it's crucial to maintain hygiene and avoid crowded places to prevent infection.”

Citizens are advised to cover their mouths when sneezing, wash hands regularly, and seek medical attention if they exhibit respiratory symptoms.
